member.name: IAMTVTuner.get_Channel

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_Channel method retrieves the channel to which the tuner is set.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the channel. For frequencies, see International Analog TV Tuning

param.name: plVideoSubChannel
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives either the video subchannel, or one of the following flags:

param.name: plAudioSubChannel
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives either the audio subchannel, or one of the following flags:

member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The AutoTune method scans for a precise signal on the channel's frequency.

member.param: Pointer to a variable indicating whether the channel's frequency was found; nonzero indicates found, zero indicates not found.
member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The IAMTVTuner interface controls a TV tuner. The TV Tuner filter implements this interface. Applications can use this interface to set TV channels and to get or set information about their frequencies, and to determine what analog video standards your TV tuner card supports.

The interface supports tuners for analog broadcast television and AM/FM radio. It supports tuners with multiple input pins, to enable multiple devices and multiple transmission types. The TV Tuner filter supports worldwide tuning coverage. It maps TV channels to specific frequencies through the and methods. These methods handle the details of the conversion, so that the hardware driver receives an exact frequency.
